text: Completing a route will count as a campaign victory and will trigger the victory achievements. Do not worry, you will still be able to keep playing to complete the other routes or go for world domination!
The journey from Bordeleaux to Bregonne is usually fraught with danger, but for the Bretonnians the seas are as smooth as glass and the wind forever in their sails.
Wherever Alberic does battle, his enemies are forced to reckon with whirlpools, tidal waves, foul weather and scores of creatures of the deep.
Alberic has supped from the grail, becoming a god amongst men.
The peasants are safe. Have them return to their labours, for idle hands are the daemon's playthings.
The scourge of undeath has been banished from the waves. Manann is pleased.
Taurox has risen to the pinnacle of Khorne's favour. Even the foremost of the Blood God's daemons are forced to serve in his warherds.

From Naggaroth to Lustria, all are prey, hunted for sport by the Slaughterhorn tribe. The strands of fate have been cut to shreds by Taurox's rune-tortured axes, and those who were once destined to bring him low now lay dead beneath his bloodsoaked hooves.

The Slaughterhorn tribe enact hideous rites at the Heart of the Dark, feeding thousands of captives into a gaping, gnashing maw at the very foundation of the herdstone. Men suffer evil dreams. Priests are plagued with temptation. Every beast feels a primal urge to kill and destroy, and the Cloven Ones march to war.

With a pulse of eldritch force, the Crown of Domination is placed upon your head. A vast ocean of battle-hardened warriors chants your name. You take up your blade and mount your steed, ready to march south to bring ruination and death to the world.

The Slayer of Kings is a huge sword with the raging soul of a captive Greater Daemon, U'zuhl, bound within it. Archaon claimed it from the hands of the Father of the Dragon Ogres, giving Archaon a weapon that has drunk the blood of kings for aeons. Now, he must decide U'zuhl's fate.
U'zhul rages within his steel prison, cursing Archaon's name. Ironically, the daemon's wrath serves only to strengthen the Everchosen further.
U'zhul has been freed from his steel prison, but is still bound to Archaon's will. The daemon now trails behind Archaon's Warhost, scavenging valuables from the fields of carnage left in their wake.
Deep beneath Middenheim there lies an ancient device, left from the age when the gods warred against the Old Ones; a device that, if properly coaxed, will unleash a rift to the Realm of Chaos.
This moondail once belonged to Captain Jaego Roth, before he was slain by Count Noctilus. It enables its owner to pull of seemingly-impossible feats of navigation and piloting.
Do you know what Aranessa Saltspite, Queen of the Pirates, did when the treasure she had sought was placed in front of her very eyes? She laughed.

Those amongst Aranessa's crew who believe her to be the daughter of Manann fight with a bravado that is rarely seen upon the sun-baked timbers of a man'o'war.  After all, who else upon the seas can claim they share the favour of a god?

Whether through Manann's divine intervention or simple chance, the floating carcasses of mighty sea beasts are a common sight for the sailors of the Swordfysh. The vampires pledged to the Pirate Queen's service waste no time reanimating the creatures and commanding them to follow in the ship's wake.
I want every gun we have to fire on that man.

As the Sartosans pillaged the rapidly sinking Bloody Reaver, one of their number came across this ancient tome. Upon touching it, they collapsed into ash. A Vampire Fleet Captain quickly recognised its importance and ensured its knowledge was not lost beneath the waves.
From the highest tower in the City of Smoke, the Supreme Matriarch safeguards the nation.
Across Cathay the merchants rejoice, for the trade routes are secure and wealth flows into the nation.
Though her warmongering would be considered rash by some of her siblings, none can deny the results.
Diplomats from the west brave the Ivory Road to kneel before the Dragon Emperor and pledge their nation to his cause.

Cultists continue to desperately chant their ritual of binding, even as the last of their defenders are cut down. Something vast roars from deep within the Dark Fortress, and a burst of blinding light briefly turns night to day. Miao dares not hope...
With Shen-Zoo safely returned, light shines on the Celestial Empire once more. The people rejoice and the shadows are banished.
Great was Shen-Zoo's fury against the servants of Chaos who had imprisoned her. Mortal warriors were torn apart by tooth and claw; legions of daemons were banished with her holy light.
The Dragon Emperor and Moon Empress are one step closer to bringing their plan to fruition, but not even their children know what that plan is.

There's more than iron in Zhao Ming's blood. He rules a province too close to the Ogre's mouth - a land blighted by fell minerals and overrun by cloaked vermin. It's got to him! His sisters know, his brothers suspect... but his mother, the Empress, will not let anyone besmirch his name.
First Kislev, then the world. All will bow before my dark majesty!
Rage and humiliation burning in his soul, Be'lakor places the Crown of Domination upon your brow and kneels before you, the true Everchosen.
Ursun is dead. The Daemon Prince finally has what Be'lakor's lying tongue once promised: the fathomless power of a God.
The nation mourns, for their queen has fallen before the Daemon Prince...
The Winds of Magic surge with newfound strength as the ancient Slann's still-beating heart is crushed in your grip. Khaine's bloodlust is sated... for now.
With the tear in reality now free to grow unchecked, legions of the Dark Prince's daemons pour through the breach.
This jewel was originally gifted to Morathi by Aenarion, before it was stolen by Anar. It cloaks the wearer in shadow.
From Ghrond's pinnacle, Sorceresses of the Dark Convent manipulate the Winds of Magic in Morathi's favour.
The Hag Queen deliberately withholds the deepest secrets of the Cauldrons of Blood, thus chaining the Witch Elves to her will.
As Hellebron bathed in the tainted blood of daemons, her lithe form surged with newfound power.
With the invaders now banished from Naggaroth's soil, the Druchii are free to refocus their efforts on conquest and plunder abroad.
As Ulthuan burns, the Everqueen rallies the last remnants of the Glittering Host at Gaean Vale. Raising her gore-slick blade to the sky, Hellebron gives the order to attack.
The White Dwarf leads his throng on the war path, seeking vengeance for ancient grievances against his people. He will not rest until the Phoenix King Finubar sues for peace!
The White Dwarf has ushered in a new era of peace between the Dwarfs and the Elves. Though they may never see eye-to-eye, the two races stand united against the forces of Chaos arrayed against them.
The Witch King is dead, turned to stone by Grungni's judgment. His hateful empire is in ruins, and his great betrayal has finally been avenged.
The realms of the Elgi boast treasures that rival even the greatest dwarfholds of the Everlasting Realm.
The White Dwarf has laid the foundation for a new Dwarfen realm amongst the snowy peaks of Naggaroth. May the Ancestor Gods watch over these trailblazers until their dying days!

The Huntsmarshal has amassed a formidable number of trophies from his many hunts across Lustria. Preparations must be made to showcase the most impressive specimens, as an Imperial delegation will soon arrive from the mainland.
The land of the lizard-beasts is conquered, exposed for the Empire to pillage to their heart's content. The Emperor's Mandate has been fulfilled!
To plunder a Lustrian temple is to court death. Only the bravest (or greediest) men do so again and again.
Marienburg's independence is no more. Rulership has been returned to the true Duke of Marienburg, Theoderic Gausser, and the wealth from its ports now flows into the imperial treasury.

Upon the battlements of Castle Drakenhof, the Emperor slew Vlad von Carstein in personal combat, staking him through the heart to ensure he would never return. The Cleansing of Sylvania has begun, though it will take many years to purge these blighted lands.
“Storm clouds gather. Our borders are beset by evil both mundane and immortal. How long can we withstand this onslaught? We must form an alliance. We either die alone, or survive together!”
After clubbing Greasus to death with his own sceptre and banishing Kholek from the mountains, the Ogres saw Grimgor as a living avatar of the Great Maw and pledged their allegiance.

With the combined might of the Greenskin and Ogre races, Grimgor cracked the Great Bastion of Cathay and burned the Dragon-fleets of Nippon. The Far East became green, and Da Immortulz soon grew to become masters at predicting and ambushing Cathayan caravan routes.
The Dawi-Zharr have reaped what they have sown. They are now slaves to Grimgor, doomed to labour at their forges to produce arms and armour for his ever-growing Waaagh!
“Dis way, ladz! I 'eard Ironhide's 'aving anuver big stunty bake!”
“Dat's right 'umie, get ma choppa nice 'n frosty.”
Wot's dis do?
Against all odds, the Glittering Host stood defiant and emerged victorious. Not since the Age of Colonisation have the Elves known such prosperity.
With the Witch King's demise, revolts have broken out across Naggaroth. Thousands of slaves and druchii defectors flee the Black Cities, and some even flock to your banner.
Ostensibly the progeny of the Everqueen and the Phoenix King, some whisper that Aliathra's pedigree is... less than certain.
After centuries of isolation, the Asrai now answer to the Phoenix King and the Elves of Ulthuan once more.
Tyrion has reclaimed the original Phoenix Crown, which was stolen by the Dwarf King Gotrek Starbreaker at the Battle of the Three Towers. This aching wound to High Elf pride can finally heal.
The world is in flames, broken and crumbling. The Exile has served his purpose.
Skarbrand's Blood Hosts sweep across the land, drowning the world in blood.
Khorne sits resplendent in his rage upon the Skull Throne, pleased with your offering. But, of course, he is never satisfied. He demands more. More! MORE!
Against all the evil that Chaos can conjure, all the wickedness that mankind can produce, we will send unto them... only you.
Against all the evil that Chaos can conjure, all the wickedness that mankind can produce, we will send unto them... only you.
Be'lakor and Kislev's fallen son are dead. Ursun's godly wrath ensured their souls never made it back to the Realms of Chaos. Never again will they threaten Kislev.
The End Times have been averted. The greatest champions the Dark Gods could muster were no match for the Red Tzar and his fearsome mount.
The Chaos Dwarfs and their thrall Greenskins were undone by a most unexpected foe - a great Kislevite host emerging out of the Chaos Wastes.
The lands of Kislev now stretch from west to east, a great bastion of ice and steel harkening back to the glory days of old. Long live the Motherland!
The Motherland, now united in purpose, sends the Red Tzar's armies much needed foodstuff, ammunition and, most important of all - kvas!
Does that hurt, comrade? I'm sorry; Sasha doesn't know his own strength sometimes. Please believe that I will learn what you're hiding from me; when I do, our next meeting will not be so pleasant.

The Mad Monk has bent the knee, claiming a vision from Ursun revealed to him the error of his ways. Perhaps this is true, or perhaps he simply realises he has lost the support of the people. Whatever the case, his zealous followers will be of great value in the wars to come.
The tears I might have shed for your dark fate... grow cold, and turn to tears of hate!
Though hordes of savage Chaos worshippers have been put to rout, countless more descend from the north, held at bay only by the might of Kislev. The Tzarina calls for aid, but who will answer?

King Louen Leoncoeur answered the call without hesitation, pledging a tenth of Bretonnia's hardier steeds to Kislev's cause. Though the Royarch must contend with his own troubles at home, he vows that Kislev will not face this threat alone.
Death-seeking dwarfs from Slayer Keep journey to Kislev in droves, chanting their deathsongs and loudly declaring the superiority of Bugman's Ale over the local kvas to anyone who will listen.
Baggage trains loaded with firearms and artillery wind their way north from the foundries of Nuln, a show of support from the Empire.

A solemn procession of Elven mages arrives at Kislev's gates in the dead of night, sent by the Warden of the White Tower of Hoeth. They stand ready to fight alongside the Defenders of the World once more.
The Ice Queen's ruinous leadership will lead Kislev astray no longer. The Motherland is stronger for it.

Where Katarin failed, Kostaltyn succeeded. Recognising the true power of the Great Orthodoxy, several Ice Witches have deserted their queen and joined their strength to Kostaltyn's, wreathing his warriors in frozen armour and battering invaders with ceaseless blizzards. The Supreme Patriarch yearns to have the heathens executed on cleansing pyres, but stays his hand, for now...
You follow a great man, but he is just a man. Follow the bear, and you will know true strength.
The followers of Handrich now see that the true path to salvation lies through the renunciation of all wealth, preferably to the Patriarchs of the Great Orthodoxy.
The wolf and the bear must stand together to brave the coming storm. The Great Orthodoxy will ensure such a union perseveres.
Rejoice, peasants. The fires of Dazh have exposed your masters for what they truly were. Feed the flames, and your salvation will be ensured.
The Geomantic Web thrums with power, the spawning pools thrash with new life - all is as the Old Ones foretold.
The servants of the Ancient Enemy in Naggaroth have been exterminated, bringing the Great Plan one step closer to fruition.
The interlopers have been purged. The Skink artisans and Kroxigor labourers can continue their work unabated.

Seafang's figurehead greedily absorbed the blood of the slain challengers smeared upon it. The ship now thrums with an eldritch power that has spread across Wulfrik's entire fleet, filling their sails with the Winds of Magic.
Baleful monuments to your dark master poison the land and whip the Winds of Magic up into a hurricane gale, allowing hordes of daemons to manifest directly into the mortal realm.

With his Gift of Tongues, Wulfrik curses foes and goads them into recklessness. Whether he's besmirching a Dwarf's honour, questioning a Bretonnian's lineage or humiliating a haughty Elf - none can ignore his insults for long.
We fought monsters, and we became them.
The Norscans of Lustria have taught Wulfrik's warriors how to harvest and coat their blades in deadly poisons from the jungles.

Nurgle's Chaos Cults rot the the world, weakening the strength of the armies of mortals and the morale of their civilian subjects. A single cough can lay low a legendary hero where feats of arms have failed. A sneeze can decimate an entire town. Where subtle measures fail, cultists can rip apart the veil between reality and the Realm of Chaos, summoning Nurgle's Daemons to lay waste with their contagions. As pestilence grips the world, Nurgle's power eclipses that of his brother gods.
The aged Necromancer's resilience to toxins rivals those of Poxfulcrum herself. This delights Ku'gath to no end, as he makes an excellent subject for which to test his latest creations.

Ku'gath took great delight in visiting the many sights and cities of Grand Cathay, showing his appreciation by sharing the many gifts he had created. Throughout the provinces, crops withered, rice paddies were blighted, and the people took ill. They called him Zin-Fa and prayed to him for salvation. He was only too happy to oblige...

Ku'gath's newest creation runs rampant through the oblasts. Brave Kossars stumble and fall, their blood crystalising in their veins, their hearts pierced in a hundred different places by the tiny shards. The Ice Witches suffer the most; their corpses nightmares to behold: great shards of ice emerging from gaping mouths and bloody eye sockets.

Ku'gath once spent several centuries within the Forge of Souls as punishment for his failure against the Dwarfs. Yet Nurgle has always been a forgiving father. This recent victory has raised Ku'gath to the pinnacle of the Urfather's favour once more.

Ku'gath, ever generous with his children, gifted them with his newest creation, derived from the pollutants found within the River Ruin. The Nurglings are soon overjoyed to discover their skin hardening like iron from this new gift.

Greasus' wealth is now so obscene that even the lowliest Gnoblar in his tribe is bedecked in finery that would beggar a noble. All vie to join the Goldtooths and share in their wealth, and even the great nations of the world are enticed by the Hoardmaster's lucrative offers.

In recognition of Greasus' indisputable dominion over these lands, the Black Dwarfs of Zhar-Naggrund have gifted him with a powerful daemon engine to strap to the back of his cart. In return, they merely ask that he look the other way when the occasional Cathayan caravan goes missing...

Grimgor's armour was forged in the blood of Dwarf Runepriests, thus granting it potent defensive properties. As it was far too small for Greasus' magnificent bulk, it was melted down and reforged into a gut-plate of terrific proportions.

The Cathayans have now accepted their place at the Overtyrant's feet. Caravans journey to his Great Hall laden with gold, gemstones and exotic meats, hoping to barter for safe passage across the Ivory Road. Each season, their profit margins grow smaller.
The Prophet's revelation came as he journeyed to both locations. The Great Maw was one god of two aspects, a mighty beast who would one day gorge on the whole world.
Skrag returns to the almighty God Mouth and pays the necessary tribute: a veritable mountain of meat harvested from those foolish enough to stand in his way.

The Great Maw's greatest prophet has founded a new Ogre Kingdom in the very heartland of Bretonnia. The Land of Chivalry is now anything but, and the Lady of the Lake has seemingly deserted her people, though some claim that she was dragged screaming into Skrag's maw-cauldron...

The Great Maw's greatest prophet has founded a new Ogre Kingdom in the centre of the Empire. This once mighty nation of men is now naught but livestock for the Ogre tribes who now call these lands their own.
The Gorgers have feasted well. Their mutated forms now ripple with power, a clear sign of the Great Maw's blessing.

Following in his predecessor's footsteps, Archaon the Everchosen leads a great host into Hell Pit, hoping to stall Clan Moulder's relentless attacks across Norsca. Yet the Castellan stands ready to repel the invaders, and he means to claim his vengeance in blood.
Winding lines of meat wagons journey towards Hell Pit, ensuring the ravenous appetites of Throt's monstrous creations are always sated.
Like a squished moth, Ariel is now nothing but a pulp consumed by Throt to abate his hunger, with the remains used to augment his twisted hench-rats!

The Mage-Queen's pulped remains have been bottled into hundreds of vials, each one worth a small fortune in warpstone. Envoys from every clan in Skavendom journey to Hell Pit in the hopes of acquiring the precious substance.
With the Everchosen's host smashed to a bloody pulp, none can stop Clan Moulder's merciless harvest of the Norscan population.
With the Mage-Queen's demise, Throt prepares to harvest her divine flesh...

The Dark Prince's power waxes so strongly that it can no longer be contained within the Realms of Chaos. Storms howl outwards from the polar gates, driving his servants onwards to commit countless unspeakable acts in his name.
And all the men and women merely playthings for the Daemonettes.

The Dark Prince's power waxes so strongly that it can no longer be contained within the Realms of Chaos. Storms howl outwards from the polar gates, driving his servants onwards to commit countless unspeakable acts in his name.
Let the arrogant fools indulge themselves in fine liquors, exotic sweetmeats and the pleasures of the flesh. Then they shall feast again, and indulge in pleasures of a different sort...
Aenarion's final humiliation is at hand. Vengeance never tasted so sweet...
Skarbrand's anguished soul now writhes within the Witstealer, granting the blade unparalleled strength.
Open your hearts to the Flesh-Tempter! No, literally...

Arkhan journeys across the dunes, enslaving Tomb Kings from every dynasty and binding their legions to his will. Those who resist are destroyed utterly - their powdered bones lost to the sands of time forevermore.
These bloodthirsty creatures will make fine foot soldiers in the wars to come. Let their blight curse the lands.
Foremost of the Dark Lords, Arkhan heralds in a new age of death and despair.

Was this Tzeentch's ultimate goal, or merely one further step towards another end? To even begin to unravel his intentions is to invite madness, for perhaps he is mad himself, and his plans are, in fact, utterly devoid of all reason.

The Plaguefather now languishes within the Forge of Souls, his soul the plaything of the daemonsmiths. Without his meddlesome interference, Nurgle's festering gardens swifly decay down to nothing, supplanted by crystalline structures which burst forth from the parched earth.
Though most of the artefacts have been sent to the Impossible Fortress for his master's inscrutable designs, others have been kept for the Fateweaver's use in personal combat.

Though the Lizardmen of the present era had little understanding of these ancient relics, Kairos had long studied their purpose within the Impossible Fortress. His mastery of their magics rivals even those of a first generation Slann.
Fate has been rewritten. Those who were once destined to defeat Kairos now lie dead beneath his claws, their arcane baubles serving only for his entertainment. All is as was foreseen...

Tzeentch's forces now control the Wu Xing Compass. This powerful artefact was once used to protect the people of Cathay. Now, it is utilised as a weapon of war, unleashing fearsome magics upon those it once safeguarded.

A thick fog blankets all of Bretonnia. Crops wither and die, entire hamlets are found empty and desolate. Tortured groans and unholy bestial roars echo through the still air. The Dark Gods are pleased.
With the Black Arc now in his possession, the Lichemaster can use the cursed warpstone to enhance his already dangerously powerful necromantic abilities.
Kemmler believes Krell is an obedient thrall who serves his own interests, but perhaps these recent victories are but one small part of a much grander scheme...
Built from the fused remains of a dozen conquered Tomb Kings, this monolith throbs with unholy power.
A portal to Sylvania will become available to Mannfred's army.

“This land is my home, my birthright. The wind and rain are my allies. The trees and stones are my foot soldiers. The very earth will rise up against you should you try to take it from me. And my people will feast on your bones.”
“Nagash was a fool, too weak to see his dreams realised. I will build an empire of death atop his broken legacy.”
From the shores of the Great Ocean to the slopes of the Worlds Edge Mountains, all pay the blood tithe and live only to serve the von Carsteins.
The portal is sealed, and the Daemons denied passage into this world. Now cleansed of all malice, the forest of Naggaroth can be bound to Athel Loren. The Weave of life and death grows ever stronger!

The Mage Queen stayed her hand in ages past. Her Heralds did not make the same mistake. Morathi is dead. Her Dark Covent unmade. Her Tower of Prophecy torn down to its foundations. Let the world be free of her scheming at last.
With the Hammer of Vaul and Caledor's volcanic furnaces at his disposal, Lord Daith's creations now rival those of the God of Smiths himself.
Whether venturing through the Old World or the New, all men should know to fear the forests.

Within the Everqueen's Grove, Alarielle reigns upon her Oaken Throne. With the passing of the seasons her body withers and the roots pierce deeper into her flesh, but Athel Avelorn thrives. Such is Isha's will.

Big-Game Hunter

Da Great Maw's Avatar

The Age of Sanctuary

Khorne Ascendant
The Reaping

Rip & Tear
Ursun's Vengeance
Apocalypse No
Dark Lands Crusaders
Kislev Ascendant
Supply Trains
The Red Room
United Against Chaos
Frozen Heart
A Call For Aid
The Northern Crusades
The Slayers Come
Shipments from Nuln
The Conclave of Light
Dethroned
Ice Court Defectors
The Scourge of Altdorf
The Conversion of Marienburg
The Syncretism of Middenheim
The Cleansing of Drakenhof
Geomantic Web Restored
Unity of Spirit

Ancient connections long severed are now repaired. Mazdamundi is able to extend his thoughts out across vast distances, and so calls for all Lizardmen everywhere to unite under his Sunburst Standard.\\n\\n
Deviation Corrected
Sins of a Solar Empire
The Winds Roar
The Daemons Come
The Eternal Challenger
Monster Hunter
Lustrian Tactics
Nurgle Ascendant
Ghorst Imprisoned
Zin-Fa the Ever-Pustulent
Kislevian Gout
The Urfather's Forgiveness
River Ruin Pathogen
Hoardmaster
Hell on Wheels
Blood-forged Gut-plate
Subservient Cathayans
More Maw!
Journey's End
A New Ogre Kingdom
The Ogre Empire
Well-Fed
Hell Pit Besieged
Highway to Hell
Deific Feast
Supply and Demand
Conqueror of Norsca
Godflesh
Slaanesh Ascendant
All The World's A Stage
Slaanesh Ascendant
Cult Following
Best Served Cold
Bound to the Blade
Sweet Surrender
Thy Will Be Done
Know Your Place
Mortarch of Sacrament
Tzeentch Ascendant
The Fateweaver's Vengeance
The Twelve Artefacts of Gilles le Breton
Artifacts of the Old Ones
Trinkets of the Slain
Corrupted Wu Xing Compass
Kingdom of the Dead
Master of the Black Arc
Dead Reckoning
The Ossified Monolith
The Soulgate
Return of the Count
The Mortarch of Night
The Dread Emperor
Sweet Dreams
Vengeance of the Mage Queen
Godlike Craftsmanship
Guardians of the Pools
Isha's Embrace
Castellan of Carnage
Ghoritch's victory over the Everchosen has only deepened his lust for slaughter and carnage. A day spent without spilling blood and crushing bone for Khorne is a day wasted.
Azazel is always searching for souls who show great promise in the eyes of the Dark Gods. More often than not, however, he finds only those who are destined to become mewling Chaos Spawn.
Headhunter
Leaders of great nations come to grovel at your feet, swearing oaths of devotion and offering up tributes to the Dark Prince. Indulge one of them, and let the others wallow in despair.
The Supplicants Come

The men of the Empire have turned away from their worship of Sigmar. His temples have been profaned, now serving as Sacrificial Altars to the Dark Prince. Azazel rules from the Imperial Throne, resplendent in his dark glory. Sigmar's name will soon pass into obscurity, his deeds forgotten, his failure complete.
Faith Forsaken

Beasts and daemons couple together beneath the light of the full moon. The horrible sounds of rutting soon subside into soft murmurs of decadence and depravity, though any who bore witness to the unholy acts quickly devolve into writhing Chaos Spawn.
A Night of Terror

King Louen's headless corpse was bound wholly in armour and sent back to Couronne. The Corpse King now reigns over a nation of fools. None dare question his increasingly nonsensical proclamations, though the stench grows stronger by the day.
The Corpse King

Beneath the twisting trees, daemons and dryads couple, giving birth to unholy misshapen creatures who are destined to bring misery to the lands of mankind. At Drycha's command, glamoured Elves are given over to Azazel's Ecstatic Legions. They succumb soon thereafter...
Forests of Sin

Azazel has transformed the Ice Palace of Kislev into his own personal harem. The enraptured Ice Witches bow to his every whim. Meanwhile, the nation rejoices, for the Tzarina at last has an heir. None dare question their new prince's pedigree, however, for those that did were promptly disappeared by the Akshina.
Eternal Winter
Azazel rules Cathay from the Dragon Emperor's throne. Within his Celestial Pleasure Palace every vice is indulged, every temptation is pursued - no matter how heinous.
The Celestial Pleasure Palace
The Great Tribulation

Altdorf was once a proud beacon of civilisation in the war-torn lands of the Old World. Now, it is nothing more than a cragmire of death. With every passing moment, plague-ridden corpses flourish into tangled masses of alien vegetation. At the city's heart, reality buckles and fades, and daemons pour forth from the wound.
The Lustrian Plagues
Upon delivery of the ingredients, the sickly ratman lowers his hood, revealing a shocking sight...
Festus Empowered

A storm rumbled overhead, the indulgent laughter of a father proud of his son's antics. Festus was lit from within by a green-white light that poured from his eyes and mouth, his entire form resonating with the fell energies now bestowed upon him. The Fecundites bowed low, chanting his name over and over again. Surely, he now stands on the very threshold of daemonhood...
The Bowelworm Pandemic
Those who sup from the tainted waters soon find themselves confined to the privy, condemned to give birth to a torrent of red-ringed worms until their lifeforce is utterly spent.
The Fugue Fog

Citizens stumble through the fume-choked cities of the Old World in a daze, coughing up blood and soon going blind as the smog ravages their eyes. Though most survive its effects, they inevitably succumb to madness and despair.
The Three-Eyed King Approaches

Though the Warhost of the Apocalypse has been subdued, Archaon still remains defiant. Biding his time, he moves to confront Vilitch at his weakest moment: when Mannslieb shines brightly in the sky. So predictable...
Corrupted Wu Xing Compass

Tzeentch's forces now control the Wu Xing Compass. This powerful artefact was once used to protect the people of Cathay. Now, it is utilised as a weapon of war, unleashing fearsome magics upon those it once safeguarded.
Quai Yin's Lament
With the diamond in your possession, the Moon Empress’ designs, whatever they were, have been thwarted. Her screams of rage were reportedly heard echoing down from the Celestial City.
Fractured Psyche
In the light of the baleful moon, the Everwatcher and the Curseling shattered Archaon's psyche, transforming him into a slavering brute, obedient to Vilitch's every command.
Runes of Binding

Archaon's flesh was carved with Tzeentchian runes of binding, forcing him to obey Vilitch's every command. Though the Everchosen still rallies the Forces of Chaos towards the End Times, none know the truth about his newfound allegiance...
The Three-Eyed King Approaches

Archaon emerges from the Chaos Wastes, evidently infuriated by the Curseling's brazen conquest of the northmen. Biding his time, he moves to confront Vilitch at his weakest moment: when Mannslieb shines brightly in the sky. So predictable...
The Long Night of Chaos

In Kislev, the great temple of Ursun is struck by a bolt of pink lightning and comes to terrible life. The temple drags itself across the city and attacks the Tzarina's Ice Palace with stone tentacles, enfanged finestras and warpfire-breathing gargoyles. When the Tzar Guard muster to confront it, the temple doors burst open to disgorge a horde of cackling daemons in its defence. None are spared.
All According to Plan

As the Puppets of Misrule cornered Necoho's followers, Tzeentch's true scheme was revealed, for Necoho himself was present amongst his congregation, guised as an old man. Nine by nine Lords of Change descended on the scene from on high, and the ancient god was destroyed in a magical cataclysm of enormous scale. From his smouldering corpse, a gateway to the Realm of the Sorcerer was opened.
Khorne's Favoured
Khorne roared in triumph when Valkia returned bearing the Witch King's severed head. He showered her in glory, raising her up to the very pinnacle of martial strength.
Forsaken by Khaine

Though the Brides of Khaine are expert practitioners of violence, theirs is a tepid, restrained violence of ritual and sacrifice. The warriors of Khorne are violence incarnate, relentless and chaotic. Upon the field of battle, there is no question whose methods are superior.
Naggaroth's Ruin

Rivers of blood stain the snows of Naggaroth red. Smoke chokes the skies as dozens of ravaged settlements burn. Towering monoliths dot the landscape, each one a monument to a champion of Khorne who has been lifted up to daemonhood. All is as it should be.
N'Kari Approaches

Enraged at the constant humiliations frequented upon him, N'Kari has returned from the Realms of Chaos once more. Unconcerned, Valkia readies Slaupnir and prepares to humble the Keeper of Secrets yet again.
A Skull for the Throne
Those who bear witness to N'Kari's severed head are overawed at Valkia's might. Northmen flock to her banner, and servants of the Dark Prince question their own convictions.
A Bloodborne Hatred
Though consuming N'Kari's heart granted the Gorequeen untold power, she now finds an overwhelming hatred of Elves burning within her.
Khorne's Favoured
Khorne roared in triumph when Valkia returned bearing the Ice Queen's severed head. He showered her in glory, raising her up to the very pinnacle of martial strength.
Conquest of the Dark Lands

Rivers of blood drench the parched wasteland. Smoke chokes the skies as dozens of ravaged settlements burn. Towering monoliths dot the landscape, each one marking a monument to a champion of Khorne who had been lifted up to daemonhood. All is as it should be.
Saviour of the Forest

Envoys from Athel Loren arrive on dragonback, thanking the Knights of Caledor for their deeds. The Wood Elves remain for some time, teaching their kin some finer points of forest warfare, before departing back to their home.
A New Ally

A royal retinue of staggering majesty arrives from the east, led by none other than the Jade Dragon himself. Imrik and Minaithnir are overawed at the display, and the trio converse for many hours. When the Cathayan Prince departs, Imrik smiles fondly. He is confident the Elves have found a new ally in the people of Cathay.
The Dragon Forges of the Dark Lands

Overthrown by the Knights of Caledor, the diabolic forges of the Black Dwarfs have since been repurposed to harness the dragon's flame. Zharr-Naggrund now serves as the lair of the dragon Lamoureux, Bane of Hashut.
Shackolot's Revenge
The Lahmians supped on Shackolot's blood for years, feeding on his power. In the end, such power was but a flickering candle before the Black Dragon's fury. Ash is all that remains of them now.
Caledor Eternal

Within the Hall of Dragons, Ymwrath sings the songs of awakening, rousing his kin from their long slumber. As a Star Dragon, his knowledge of the world is vast, and he is only too eager to pass on his wisdom to his younger kin.
Gordinar's Treasure Hoard
Gordinar's conquests in the Badlands have allowed him to amass a modest treasure hoard for a dragon of his age. He is reluctant to part with even a single coin, but does so at Imrik's insistence.
Necrotic Surge
With the ichor of the Plaguefather, the bones of the dragon Minaithnir, and the blood of the Grand Theogonist, Helman enacts his grand ritual atop the highest steeple of Nagashizzar.
The Numberless Dead
Helman's horde of walking corpses is beyond counting, swollen to unstoppable proportions by the massacre of Cathay's inhabitants.
The Pact
Blood and bone simmers within the Darkforged Vessel. The preparations are complete. Helman begins intoning words of dread power from the Liber Noctis...
Daemonic Possession

Though his brothers have passed on to Morr's Garden, the price for their safe passage was steep. Helman's soul is now forfeit to Malal, and his body is now under daemonic possession. Eyes glowing with balefire, Helman now serves the Renegade God.
Tethered Spirits

Enraged at the daemon's lies, Helman has captured the entity and taken its powers for his own. Using this newfound strength, he has bound his brothers' spirits to their ravaged bodies, but still, something is wrong. They beg for death. Surely, they would be grateful. Determined as ever, Helman continues his hopeless quest.
A Captive Audience

When the Siren sings, the wisest of her audience, be they slave or slaver, applaud and cheer her name, even as blood trickles from their ears. The fools who don't are dragged beneath the waves, re-emerging later with blue witch-lights burning in their eyes.
A Light in the Darkness

As Cylostra ventured deeper into the black abyss, she realised she was not alone. The ocean teemed with strange humanoid creatures who were drawn to her ethereal light like moths to a flame. They quickly scattered as a towering behemoth rose from the depths, a creature of primordial malevolence and alien intelligence. Its glowing eyes transfixed Cylostra, and her mind was filled with ancient knowledge.
Terrors from the Abyss

As the Lamprey sails to war, all manner of strange sea creatures follow in her wake - soldiers of the Undersea Empire. Whether living or dead, they all share one thing in common: a deep hunger for the blood of the land-dwellers.
The Sunken Soliloquy

The Court of the Phoenix King now rests at the bottom of the Straits of Lothern. Her zombified 'stagehands' have since converted it into a sunken opera house. The time has finally come. Cylostra will sing for the Phoenix King!
A Triumphant Return
Cylostra's siren call echoes across the land, luring knights from all across Bretonnia to renounce the Lady of the Lake and pledge themselves to their new mistress, even unto death!
Cackling Corpses
As the Drowned march to war, the sound of their mocking laughter spreads fear and confusion throughout the enemies' ranks.
Intrepid Freebooters
Emboldened by Cylostra's stirring performance, the Drowned seek to emulate the heroic feats of the noble Knights of Bretonnia.
The Sorrowful Dead
Cylostra's haunting melodies inflict the Drowned with a prolonged sense of melancholy. Since misery loves company, they are only too willing to share their fate with Cylostra's foes.
All Eyes On Me
Cylostra basks in the adoration of the masses, curtsying gracefully as she receives a standing ovation. King Finubar claps so hard his hands fall off!
Seek, and Ye Shall Find

As the peasants struggled to survive in these arid lands, Repanse instructed them to seek out the Fleur de Lys and to dig wherever the magical lilies were to be found. Sure enough, groundwater bubbled up from the earth, and thus, with the Lady's guidance, a new Bretonnian kingdom thrived.
The Eternal Errantry War

The dead have been defeated. The lands of Nehekhara are now free of the taint of evil that was inflicted so many years ago by the black-hearted sorcerer, Nagash. Yet evil still thrives in the lands beyond the Lady's reach. The Damoiselle de Guerre knows that the fight must go on.
Secure Shipping Lanes
The pirate ships and their undead crews now rest at the bottom of the ocean. Vital supplies can now flow freely from the mainland, sustaining Repanse's exploits in the desert and beyond.
Jungle Warfare

Henri, a veteran of countless campaigns, advises his charge that cavalry actions will be severely hampered by the dense jungles. Repanse acknowledges his sage counsel and instructs her archers to train hard. They will be instrumental in the wars to come.
Into the Lion's Den

The Greenskins are infamous for their love of fighting. When they hear that an entire company of Bretonnians have breached their lands, they will descend upon them like flies to carrion. Repanse orders the men-at-arms to be outfitted with the very best arms and armour, for they must hold the line until the clarion call is sounded.
The Curse Denied

Through subtle arcane means, Astragoth transposes his curse to his unwitting disciples and thus postpones his own petrification indefinitely. Each season adds new ranks of petrified sorcerors to Zharr-Naggrund's causeway, and Astragoth's reign continues in perpetuity.
An Old Foe Returns

As the last of the Greenskins scatters before the implacable might of the Disciples of Hashut, one among their number fights on. Astragoth readies his hammer and moves to put down this stubborn orc personally…
Reign of Iron

Under Ironhand’s reign, the Dawi-Zharr Empire has reached a new pinnacle of power and influence. Great nations of men have been laid low, their denizens consigned to back-breaking labour in the factories and strip mines that now pockmark the Old World.
Bellicose Labourers
With the legendary Black Orc Grimgor Ironhide in chains alongside them, the Greenskins are stoked to new heights of violence.
Cowed Labourers
Grimgor's shattered skull serves as a warning to all Greenskins who would dare rise up against their betters.
The Warfleet Resurgent

From the Falls of Doom to Ruin's End, the River Ruin is now completely under Drazhoath's control. The massive iron sluices of Zharr-Naggrund open and the warfleet emerges, ready to make the long journey to the open sea.
The Conquest of Cathay

Hordes of Cathay’s citizens are sacrificed in spectacular blood rituals for Drazhoath’s dark designs. Those fortunate enough to escape such horrors are sent to mines and factories across the Dark Lands, though some would argue this is a far worse fate.
New Converts

After centuries of ignorance, the Dwarfs of the Karaz Ankor now know the truth that the Dawi-Zharr learnt long ago: that the Ancestor Gods have forsaken all dwarf-kind. Some of the less stubborn survivors, undoubtedly the wisest of their kin, have pledged themselves to the Father of Darkness.
Labour Surplus
A great influx of labourers from the holds of a captured Black Ark has resulted in an impressive spike in productivity across the empire!
Hashut’s Favour

As the Black Ark burned, the earth rumbled, and the sea began to boil. The ship slipped beneath the waves, and the Infernal Guard whispered praises to Hashut as their weapons took up their Dark Father’s flame.
Corrupted Wei-Jin Compass

Ghorth the Cruel was well pleased to receive news of the conquest of [[col:fe_white]]Wei-Jin[[/col]]. A convoy of Daemonsmiths was sent to the [[col:fe_white]]Celestial Palace[[/col]] with great haste, where they wrought their fell magics upon the coveted [[col:fe_white]]Wei-Jin Compass[[/col]].
A Daring Raid

The Warhost of Zhar lays siege to the [[col:subtitle_azazel]]Marcher Fortress[[/col]], intent on plundering its vast arsenal of hell-forged weapons. Such an action will surely draw the ire of the Dark Prince, but Zhatan is not concerned. He raises his axe and gives the order to attack, laughing all the while.
The Fire Mouth Forge
Zhatan’s forces have pacified their unruly neighbours, even going so far as to convert their volcanic deity into yet another forge for the ever-expanding empire.
Perfected Black Orcs

Negotiations with Clan Moulder bore fruit, and the Sorcerer-Prophets were able to devise a means to dominate the will of the Black Orcs completely. Such a feat has elevated Zhatan to the peak of the Conclave’s favour.
Sorcerous Might
After careful study of the weaponry stolen from the Marcher Fortress (and fastidious experimentation upon hapless Labourers) the Sorcerer-Prophets can harness Hashut’s fire like never before.
Refined Constructs
By studying the strange and exotic weapons plundered from the Marcher Fortress, the Daemonsmiths have successfully refined their daemonic constructs.
Daemonstock

Manlings make perfect vessels for the daemons. They spend the long journey back to the forges of the Dark-Lands in sorcerous chains, howling for release and promising their captors a slow, painful death.
Sigmar's Desert
The great deserts of Nehekhara have been conquered in the name of Sigmar. From this new base of power, Volkmar supports his ambitions further abroad.
The Exorcist

“Hear Me and obey, thou foulest Daemon! I cast ye out with the Might of My Arm, with the Iron of My Will and by the Fire of My Word. Ever shall I pit myself against thy kind, and eternal shall be my wrath in the face of thy masters.”
The Final Seal
With the final book in his possession, Volkmar journeys to Altdorf to seal them away in the vaults deep beneath the Holy Temple of Sigmar.
War Eternal
Emboldened by their recent victory, Volkmar's zealous troops are eager to embark on the next holy war. The Grand Theogonist sees no reason to deny them.
Faith & Steel

The rabid mobs that constitute the bulk of Volkmar's forces were outfitted with freshly forged arms and armour. Such a decision was questioned by some politicians in Altdorf, but the Grand Theogonist paid no heed to their concerns.
The Harbinger
From east to west, all is ruin, all is despair, all is Chaos. Whether mortal or daemon, all will learn to fear the name... Be'lakor.
The First and the Last

The Dark Brothers could only howl with frustration as they witnessed Be'lakor subjugate their greatest champions. Now, the Dark Coronation will begin again, but this time the son will crown the father.
The Time is Nigh
Deep within the Forge of Souls, Be'lakor's newest creation shudders with a roar of tortured metal and agonised souls. The Aetherophasic Engine is ready. All it needs is a target...
The Badlands Blood-Ground

Across the war-torn Badlands, the Harbinger's fell influence is omnipresent. Crumbling dwarfholds are reclaimed by the vengeful earth, blood-watered soil nourishes strange, alien flora, and the war-steeds and livestock of the Greenskins grow to colossal size, and with frothing rage devour the tribes that had hunted and enslaved them for centuries.
Despoiler of the Sacred

With cruel relish, Malagor snuffed out his foes one-by-one. Their proud temples and soaring castles were torn down to their foundations and refashioned into mighty Herdstones. There are some who survived the bloodshed, however. On wings as black as night, Malagor descends to decide their fate.
Ritual of the Nine Daemons
With the tainted blood and splintered bones of cursed men, Malagor's fell ritual spells the doom of the Undying King once and for all.
Faith Forsaken

Malagor's flock soars over the desert, descending wherever a Sigmarite colony is found. Their priests and priestesses are slaughtered upon their own altars, their flesh devoured and blood drunk in vile mockery of their most holy sacraments.
Sacrificial Pyre
The Damoiselle de Guerre screams out her last atop a raging pyre. Her agonised cries stoke the Beastmen to new heights of carnage.
Hunting Season
Malagor's Harbingers stampede through the jungles of the Southlands, revelling in the thrill of the chase and its inevitable, bloody conclusion.
Scale Armour
Scores of Lizardmen are skinned alive and devoured by the ravenous Beastmen. Their thick, scaled hides will serve the warherd well when fashioned into crude armour and shields.
Jade Griffon Banner
Even the faith of mighty Volkmar was sorely tested as he was taken up and chained to the battle standard of Malagor's warherd.
Carnosaur Exhibit
The delegation were overawed by the sheer size of the Carnosaur and vowed to send more shipments from Nuln's foundries to help the colonies fight off these ferocious creatures.
Rat Ogre Exhibit

Though most members of the delegation questioned if the creature before them was indeed a giant rat, and not merely a mutated Lustrian beast, all agreed that the threat of plague in these foreign lands was very real, and that steps should be taken to prevent further outbreaks.\\n
Black Dragon Exhibit

Though the Huntsmarshal struck the Black Dragon dead with a single shot from his Amber Bow, his men suffered great losses at the hands of the black magic of the Dark Elves. All present agreed that more Wizards from the Imperial Colleges should be dispatched to ensure the expedition's continued success.
Leviathan Exhibit

After his brother Jacob perished at sea, the Huntsmarshal vowed to continue his quest to hunt down the most infamous sea monsters that prowled the world's oceans. The delegation agreed to divert funds from the Imperial treasury to assist with this endeavour.
Dark Lands Warpforges
The many forges of the Chaos Dwarfs now serve Clan Rictus, outfitting scores of Stormvermin with warpforged arms and armour.
Morskrit's Boon
Standing atop the highest towers of the Dark Lands, the Grey Seers conduct their fell rituals to guide Warpstone Meteors towards the base of Crookback Mountain, where they can be harvested safely.
Unwelcome Guests

Skreet Blackblade, right-claw to the Supreme Warlord of Clan Rictus, has made the long journey to the Everpeak to “congratulate” Tretch in person for his momentous victory. Tretch is no fool. He has already made the necessary preparations…
Fozzrik's Freight-Fleecing Flimflam
Tretch uses Fozzrik's magic to amass a vast collection of arcane treasures, summoning the contents of hidden vaults or entire baggage trains to the Flying Fortress.
The Fifth Great Clan

Clan Mors is no more, their greatest warriors subjugated or slain. With this great victory, Clan Rictus has risen to prominence as a Great Clan, rivalling the ancient clans of Skyre, Pestilens, Eshin and Moulder in military and political influence.
Supreme Warlord Tretch Craventail
After his conquest of the Worlds Edge Mountains, Tretch seized control of Clan Rictus and slew Kratch Doomclaw in a fair and honourable duel. Well, that's how Tretch tells it anyway...
Grand Chieftain of the Deep Warrens and High Peaks
Let that fool Doomclaw continue to serve Clan Rictus' interests on the Council of Thirteen. All know that mighty Tretch is the true power behind Clan Rictus.
The Jade Compass
With the power of the Geomantic Web surging through the Wu Xing Compass, the Dragon Emperor and Moon Empress are one step closer to bringing their plan to fruition.
United as One
With whispered words and decapitating strokes, the Jade Dragon has renewed a fractured nation.
Yuan Bo the Omniscient

Thousands of ink black eyes stare out across the land, taking in each detail and following every movement. From east to west, from the Old World to the New, none escape the Jade Dragon's watchful eyes.
Triumph of the Motherland
The armies of Kislev's enemies crumble, burdened by the darkest of magics. Somewhere, deep in the forests, a cackling laugh echoes through the wind...
Lustrian Concoction
A single drop delivered to the eye engorges the creatures of the forest with newfound power. But to drink the substance is another matter entirely...
The Fatherland

The once meagre colony at Bleak Hold Fortress has swelled into a mighty nation that rivals the Motherland in strength and prosperity, though even the most prideful Kislevite knows to never, ever venture too deeply into the forests.
Cathayan Concoction
A single drop delivered to the eye engorges the creatures of the forest with newfound power. But to drink the substance is another matter entirely...
Guardian of Kislev

Thanks to Mother Ostankya's efforts, the corruption of the Chaos Wastes continues to recede towards the Polar Gate. Though she is still considered an outcast, a grateful Motherland now sends baggage trains loaded with provisions in tacit support of her campaign against the daemons.
Ultimate Trickster

As the Changeling lounged upon his master's throne, divine power surged through his veins. Though the other Dark Gods would obliterate their servants for such an audacious act, Tzeentch merely laughed.
The Many-Faced King

Whether writing taunts in the Dammaz Kron or directing Settra's dutiful legions to go swimming in the Great Mortis River, the Changeling's influence is omnipresent. From Wei-Jin to Ulthuan, none can escape his antics!
Quai Yin's Lament

As her children lay dead or dying, the Moon Empress moved to intercede. Divine intervention could not avail them, however, and only served to betray her whereabouts. The shapeshifters fought for days, flitting between a thousand different forms. Inevitably, the Changeling was repelled, though not before stealing from her that which was most precious...
A Flaw Revealed
Across Cathay, the leylines surge with renewed energy. Yet all is not as it was. An abberation disrupts the flow of magic, causing countless deviations in the Great Plan. This must be corrected...
Saviour of Lustria
The warmbloods have been sent packing back to their decadent civilisation, proven to be no match for the Lizardmen. Least of all, for Nakai the Wanderer!
Bane of Chaos
Not since the Bridge of Stars has Nakai dealt such a grievous blow to the Ancient Enemy.
The Great Purge
The Spirits of the Jungle will not rest until Wei-Jin is in flames and the dragons have been ousted from their Celestial Palace. It is the will of the Old Ones.
Pacified Compass
The Cathayans and the Lizardmen have come to an accord. With the guidance of the Slann Mage Priests, the Wu Xing Compass was safely integrated into the Geomantic Web.
Blood Runes of Warding
With the blood of Avelorn's slain, Khaine's followers daub their bare flesh with runes of warding that cheat a foe's blade and blunt even the most vicious attacks.
The Dark Feast
The Druchii feast upon the savaged corpses of their foes, drawing strength from Avelorn's mightiest warriors and renewing their bloodlust for the battles to come.
The Dark Power
Finally, Snikch has located the mysterious power! Should he decide to keep it for himself, not even his master – nor any of the Lords or Decay for that matter – will be able to challenge him!
Contract Killers
Demand for Clan Eshin's services are at an all-time high after their recent successes within Cathay. Though some complain of their exorbitant prices, none can deny the results.
The Eshin Empire

Barren, warpstone-strewn plains are all that remain of Cathay's bountiful paddy fields and verdant forests. The Skaven now rule these lands, consuming or enslaving any foolish enough to still venture here.
Drinker of Worlds
Snikch's Weeping Blades seem to have a mind of their own, now possessed by the Drinker of Worlds. The Deathmaster's prized weapons will forever afflict him with Tz'arkan's daemonic torment!
Knowledge is Power
The Grey Seers have learned much from their studies of the Drinker of Worlds.
An Oath Renewed

Though Garagrim had taken up the Slayer Oath in his father’s stead, Ungrim could not bear the loss of his son, and so swore the oath once more. With none to continue his bloodline, Ungrim now stands as the last of the Slayer Kings.
The Land of Bitter Flame

The Chaos Dwarfs have been driven to the edge of extinction. Ungrim has freed the Dark Lands from their tyranny, though at grave cost. The Dawi-Zharr had fallen far, and most chose death over renunciation of their Father of Darkness. Yet from the ashes, the first seeds of a new era take root. The forges of Zharr-Naggrund roar once again, but now the smiths craft not weapons of war, but the foundations of a brilliant, gleaming future.
The Journey Home
As Ungrim and his warband journeyed home through the sparse woodlands of Dukhlys Forest, a shrill horn echoed through the wind…\\n
The Folly of Thalandor

Ungrim is shocked to recognise Thalandor Doomstar among the dead, an infamous Elf who once besieged Karak Kadrin for a full season. The wutelgi have ever been a thorn in the Karaz Ankor's side. Perhaps it is time to be rid of them, one and for all?
Let Bygones Be Bygones

The leader of the Elves approaches, and Ungrim is shocked to discover it is the infamous Thalandor Doomstar, Glade Lord of Argwylon. Despite their troubled history, the grateful elf thanks Ungrim for his aid and offers him a token of friendship. Perhaps there is hope for the two nations after all?
Eternal Reign
From the shores of the Great Ocean to the slopes of the Worlds Edge Mountains, all pay the blood tithe and live only to serve the von Carsteins.
The High King's Vow

“They have breached the Great Hall and plundered the lower vaults. We have fought our way to the airfields and hold them for now, but every brave dawi that falls to the horde rises again and raises his axe against us. Curse the Uzkuli and their foul sorcery! Though hope flickers in the stoutest of hearts, I have rallied my warriors for one final charge. By Grimnir, I will cut off the head of that Zangunaz, or die in the attempt!”\\n\\n - The Dammaz Kron, final entry
Hearts of Ice

In the frozen heart of Kislev, pale maidens drink chilled blood while they conduct matters of state. All serve the will of the von Carsteins, save the Ice Queen herself. Within Castle Drakenhof, her mutilated corpse is on display, preserved in a block of ice. In times of melancholy, Isabella need only look upon her grotesque trophy and her spirits are swiftly lifted.
The Ancestor Tombs of Karaz-a-Karak
Vlad's Necromancers work tirelessly to dismantle the many protective wards safeguarding the ancient dwarfen warriors, so they can be raised to fight once more.
The Treasure Vaults of Karaz-a-Karak
Long winding columns of baggage trains wend their way from the Everpeak to Castle Drakenhof, gradually emptying the mountain of its vast stores of gold and runic armaments.
Saviour of Ulthuan
As word spreads of Alarielle's victories, despair vanishes like shadows in daylight and a newfound resolve arises to take its place.
Anathema to the Tainted

Even the blackest shadow could not withstand the Everqueen's holy light. With a single touch, Be'lakor was banished from the world. With a simple gesture, the dark bindings of Mousillon's undead were unravelled. With a soothing word, Hellebron's tainted soul was cleansed by Isha's holy light, leaving naught but a glowing mound of ash where once the Blood Queen stood.
The Tears of Isha

The Everqueen has journeyed across the world, gathering many Tree Spirits and Wood Elves to her cause. With the Treeman Oakheart’s help, she now stands ready to confront the Queen of the Woods and cleanse her tainted soul.
Avatar of Isha
None know for certain what occurred at the heart of the Oak of Ages, only that Alarielle emerged alone, radiant with newfound power, wielding both the Stave of Avelorn and the Wand of the Wych Elm.
Saviour of Athel Loren
With Ariel's corruption cleansed from the world, the forests bloom once more. None can deny that a new Queen in the Woods safeguards Athel Loren now.
The Everwinter

A supernatural blizzard has descended upon Throgg's kingdom and shows no signs of abating. Under cover of darkness, his subjects lay waste to entire nations, leaving desolate fields of cracked ice and frozen bones in their wake.
The Conqueror Comes
While butchering a Kislevite settlement, the Troll King comes face-to-face with one of the Eagle God's servants: Aekold Helbrass.
Throgg the Liberator
Throgg's retinue now boasts the largest assortment of Trolls ever witnessed in living memory. Under their king's wise rule, they have fed well on the flesh of their enemies.
Knives in the Dark
With none left to oppose them, Alith's Shadows run rampant over Naggaroth, sowing fear and discord amongst even the most black-hearted Druchii.
Lileath's Blessing
The Shadow King is clearly high in the Maiden's favour. Fortune follows him and his followers, and many now whisper that his fate must be divinely guided.
Nagarythe Eternal
From his ancestral seat of Tor Anlec, the Shadow King brought justice to the wicked. With the Druchii threat dealt with, can House Anar finally know peace?
Food for Thought
Since consuming the would-be Conqueror of Kislev, Throgg’s regenerative capabilities have blossomed to new heights.
Life Finds A Way
The radiant flesh of Aekold’s corpse brings bountiful life to the bleak lands of Throgg’s kingdom.
Trouble in Tilea

Though Zarakzil's foes all found the end of Belegar's hammer, the Skaven still swarm in ever greater numbers from the Blighted Marsh. Bugman's Rangers venture into the depths to discover the source of the infestation...
Belegar Siegemaster
Campaigning in Bretonnia has given Belegar and his throng ample experience fighting both above and beneath the ramparts.
The Woods Provide
Whether through conquest or diplomacy, the Exile King has secured resources from Athel Loren to aid in his expedition to Karak Eight Peaks.
Return of the King
Through hammer blows unending,\\non oaths of carven stone,\\nthe true king of the mountain,\\nshall come into his own!
Angrund's Triumph
Clan Angrund's royal standard now sports the severed heads of Skarsnik and Queek Headtaker, slain in single combat by the one true king of Karak Eight Peaks.
Worlds Edge Warlord

Red eyes glower from the depths of every cavernous lair and ruined dwarfhold across the Worlds Edge Mountains. Squigs bound across every slope, and the noxious fumes of Mad Cap Mushrooms blanket every valley. Atop the highest peak, upon the stunties' Throne of Power, Warlord Skarsnik lords over all. This is only the beginning!
Be Fruitful and Multiply!
Gobbla and his herd have feasted well on all manner of creatures found in the east, much to Skarsnik's relief. It would seem variety is indeed the spice of life!
The Last King of the Eight Peaks

With none left to contest his rule, Skarsnik now stands as the Last King of the Eight Peaks. For the merest of moments, he is content, but then quickly grows bored. With a tug of his chain, he sets off with his faithful companion, Gobbla, in search of new victims for his sneaky schemes and tricksy traps.
Ambush at Da Dropz!

While Skarsnik is relieving himself at Da Dropz, he is set upon by a fighty Orc. The crafty git caught him with his pants down, literally! Thankfully, a saviour arrives from the most unexpected of places...
Cathayan Treasures
Exotic spiced meats, loads of shiny choppas and precious gems - every Warlord's dream!
Gorduz Gobbla-food

Gorduz's eyes gleamed with murderous intent, furious at Skarsnik's reply. He raised his blade for a second time, but never got a chance to swing it. Gobbla came bounding into the scene, hungry as ever, and in one great gulp swallowed the Hobgoblin whole!
What Did You Expect?

As the Crooked Moon tribe came upon the smoking ruins of a Cathayan caravan, they were set upon by a host of Chaos Dwarfs. Though Skarsnik led his tribe to victory, their losses were great. When the dust settled, Gorduz Backstabber was nowhere to be seen...
We Are Legion
The Headtaker's trophy rack groans with a litany of voices, some enraged at their imprisonment, others humiliated at their defeat, but all subservient to mighty Queek!
The Southlands Slaughterer
All fear the crimson terror of the Southlands. Whether fleeing across windswept dunes or hiding in sweltering jungles - he will find you.
Lord of the City of Pillars
“The City of Pillars is ours, from deepest deep to loftiest peak! Queek brings you this greatest of victories, only Queek!”
War-King Tyrant-General Queek Headtaker
After a great battle in the depths of Skavenblight, Queek emerged triumphant over his old master. He cares not for Gnawdwell’s machinations. He longs only for battle!
Rulers of Skavendom
Warlord Gnawdwell successfully unleashed the Withering Idol upon his adversaries. None survived. Clan Mors has emerged triumphant, and Queek has proven himself as a trusted right paw to his master.
Journey to Skavenblight
Queek journeys to Skavenblight to present the Withering Idol to his master. When he arrives, the War-King of Clan Mors reveals to his favoured subordinate his true intentions for the device…
The Storm Breaks

Together, the grand alliance forged at the Conclave of Light drove back the Forces of Darkness. All bore witness to the legendary duel between the Emperor and the Everchosen. With a mighty blow from Ghal Maraz, the world’s salvation was assured, and Archaon was cast screaming into the void.
The Cleansing Tide

The sappers from the Engineering Guild successfully diverted the Tilean Sea into the Blighted Marshes. Now, Skavenblight is nothing but a labyrinth of flooded tunnels and collapsed caves, the resting place for countless drowned ratmen.
Master or Slave?
Malus has thwarted his foes and is ready to journey back to Naggaroth. Yet Tz'arkan whispers in his mind, laying before him a different path to tread...
The Terror

“From out of the howling snows he came, pale as a frost-bitten corpse. Our mightiest warriors strove to cut him down, but none could stand against him.”\\n- Svendal the Coward, last survivor of the Skornling Tribe
Old World Feeding Grounds

Astride his mount, Spite, Malus Darkblade led packs of ravenous Cold Ones across the Old World. Their population has since exploded out of control, as they have few predators in these lands, and now they can be found as far south as the outskirts of Athel Loren.
Drachau Supreme
The trophies Malus harvested from beyond the Worlds Edge Mountains left few to doubt his strength and cruelty. The Eight Families have been tolerably docile ever since.
Secrets of the Hydra Queen
Claiming the Scrolls of Hekarti for himself, Malus now stands in direct opposition to the Witch King.
Favoured Servant
Malekith is now one step closer to his ultimate goal of conquering Ulthuan. As promised, he has granted Malus access to a new elixir that can silence the daemon for days at a time.
